title: Arches National Park: Permits & Reservations
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Permits & Reservations              Permits & Reservations       Permits Backpacking Arches is a relatively small park with little terrain for backpacking. In order to backpack, you must obtain a free backcountry permit at the visitor center. The maximum group size is 10, but smaller groups are recommended to reduce impacts. Permits may not be reserved in advance. Commercial Use Authorization Businesses interested in conducting tours or similar services in the park must first obtain a Commercial Use Authorization. Fiery Furnace Day-Use Hiking Permit To enter the Fiery Furnace, visitors must accompany a ranger-guided tour or obtain a hiking permit at the visitor center. Special Use Permit Permits are required for commercial filming and photography, First Amendment actions, or special events (e.g. weddings). Reservations Campground March through October, individual and group sites at the Devils Garden Campground may be reserved in advance through www.recreation.gov. Reservations are not accepted by the park and the park does not maintain information about site availability. Fiery Furnace Guided Hikes Reservations for the Fiery Furnace guided hike between April and September can be made online. Additional hikes in the Fiery Furnace may be available. first-come, first-served.
